definition: to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: How would you rank the brand perception of massage chair?
sentences.chinese: 你將如何排名對按摩椅品牌的觀感？

sentences.english: The three live in different circumstances and so have different views about the revolution.
sentences.chinese: 三種狀況不同，對於革命的觀感也各別。

sentences.english: Stalin obviously had an acute and particular sense of history.
sentences.chinese: 史達林對於歷史明顯的有着尖銳與近乎苛求的觀感。

sentences.english: Each design has a different feel to it.
sentences.chinese: 每一種設計都有不同的觀感。

sentences.english: It shaped my sense of the world.
sentences.chinese: 它塑造了我對這世界的觀感。

definition: direct observation/directly perceived through the senses/intuitive/audiovisual
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
whole entity/entire body/synthesis/as a whole (situation, construction, team etc)/global/macrocosm/integral/holistic/whole
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
